explains: n. 化身；道成肉身；典型

sentences.en: The regime was the very incarnation of evil.
sentences.cn: 该政权正是邪恶的典型。

sentences.en: He believed he had been a prince in a previous incarnation.
sentences.cn: 他相信他的前生是个王子。

sentences.en: They do, however, still breathe air, having never developed anything equivalent to the gills of their earlier marine incarnation.
sentences.cn: 然而，他们虽然仍呼吸着空气，却从未进化出类似于腮这种早期海洋生物的器官。
